page.title: 15THE LOCAL LIBRARY
page.content: The local library in the village of Jacksdale is a small building on the main road which runs alongside the village. A library is a place where books can be borrowed without charge. The library has two sections: one containing children's books and one for adult books. Each member of the library has a number of tickets (a child has two). When the person has selected the books he/she wishes to borrow they are taken to the librarian. The librarian removes a ticket from inside the book and places it with the borrowers ticket. The librarian then stamps a date inside the book. This is the date by which the book has to be returned. It is usually 3 weeks. If the book is not returned by the date shown the borrower is fined a small amount.
